songs.name: There Will Never Be Another You
special_techniques: Transcribe the head.

intersong_exercises: ii V I - circle - LH root + 7 or 3 + improv remembering chord tones
play solo with metronome lagging the beat
play solo with irealpro lagging the beat
play song melody with metronome lagging the beat
play song melody with irealpro lagging the beat
play a song from the real book
chord_styles: improvising over recorded chords in a structure
very simple improv over close voicing
improv_strategies: Form short ideas (2 to 4 beats), repeat those.
Try starting a new phrase *not* on beat 1.
Especially when playing simple parts, think about articulation.
/Can/ stick to one scale across chords finding common tones.
Repeat motif in same location, but switch individual notes to match the chord/scale.
Improv should be about 80% steps and 20% skips.
Improv around simple ideas, but build progression and complexity. 1/2 to 3/4 way through A section is a good place to start building.
Scat/sing along with the improv to keep it lyrical.
Think about structural aspects: simple to complex, short to long, repeats, and space.

activities.activity: transcribe a song: chords, melody, solo - whole song across sessions
practice vocal scales across my range - instrument + voice + metronome
practice instrument scale - instrument + voice when possible + metronome
practice chord changes - instrument + voice when possible + metronome
practice improvisation - instrument + voice when possible + metronome
play from lead sheet - chords/melody + metronome - LH+RH techniques + transposition
sight read pop music - rhythm/chords/melody/etc + metronome
sight read choir music - rhythm/chords/melody/etc + metronome
point and sing - melody line (improvised or written)
practice performing an entire song w/o sheet, singing + LH+RH + transposition

goals.3: forming and playing chords - all inversions
goals.4: playing from a lead sheet - including transpositon
goals.5: knowing and playing scales and keys
goals.9: playing the fullest music you can
